entry.title: bricooke closed pull request 429 on CocoaPods/Specs
entry.content:
bricooke closed pull request 429 on CocoaPods/Specs August 28, 2012
Podspec for https://github.com/uservoice/uservoice-iphone-sdk

entry.title: bricooke commented on pull request 429 on CocoaPods/Specs
entry.content:
bricooke commented on pull request 429 on CocoaPods/Specs August 28, 2012

Sigh, gets a little uglier. uservoice-iphone-sdk includes categories also defined in YOAuth proper but renames their category name, but not the files. So, https://github.com/uservoice/uservoice-iphone-sdk/blob/master/Categories/NSData%2BOAuthResponse.h has a category UVOauthResponse (the UV is in the category name, but not the file) and the implementations seem to collide.

I'm declaring defeat on this for now. I think uservoice-iphone-sdk needs some cleanup before it'll play nicely.

entry.title: bvanderveen opened pull request 44 on github/ReactiveCocoa

bvanderveen opened pull request 44 on github/ReactiveCocoa August 28, 2012
Add +combineLatest:
1 commit with 12 additions and 1 deletion

entry.title: bvanderveen commented on issue 43 on github/ReactiveCocoa
entry.content:
bvanderveen commented on issue 43 on github/ReactiveCocoa August 28, 2012

Perhaps +combineLatest:reduce: could be deprecated in favor of composing +combineLatest: with a -select:?

entry.title: bvanderveen commented on issue 43 on github/ReactiveCocoa
entry.content:
bvanderveen commented on issue 43 on github/ReactiveCocoa August 28, 2012

for adding -combineLatest: which has the same behavior as -whenAll: except that the tuple of values is returned.

entry.title: jspahrsummers commented on issue 43 on github/ReactiveCocoa
entry.content:
jspahrsummers commented on issue 43 on github/ReactiveCocoa August 28, 2012

Right, it combines into a tuple. I don't know why that's any less of a combination. :P

entry.title: joshaber commented on issue 43 on github/ReactiveCocoa
entry.content:
joshaber commented on issue 43 on github/ReactiveCocoa August 28, 2012

@jspahrsummers I almost suggested that but it felt weird to call it -combineLatest: when it wasn't actually, you know, combining (well, I guess it does into a tuple but whatev).

entry.title: jspahrsummers commented on issue 43 on github/ReactiveCocoa
entry.content:
jspahrsummers commented on issue 43 on github/ReactiveCocoa August 28, 2012

I'm on making the changes discussed in this thread. I think it makes the most sense to just add a combineLatest: (with no reduce block), though. That gives you API consistently, and has a more transformative (rather than effective) feel.

entry.title: joshaber commented on issue 43 on github/ReactiveCocoa
entry.content:
joshaber commented on issue 43 on github/ReactiveCocoa August 28, 2012

-whenAll: in its current form is pretty minimally useful. The name also seems odd to me. Feels more like -whenAny: than -whenAll:. Lol @ Pastjosh. So what if we do this. Deprecate -whenAll:, add -whenAny: which passes the tuple from combineLatest:reduce: through.

entry.title: bvanderveen commented on issue 43 on github/ReactiveCocoa
entry.content:
bvanderveen commented on issue 43 on github/ReactiveCocoa August 27, 2012

Compare .NET ForkJoin (http://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/library/ff708019(v=vs.92).aspx)

(Pardon the links, Markdown is choking on the parens.)

entry.title: bvanderveen commented on issue 43 on github/ReactiveCocoa
entry.content:
bvanderveen commented on issue 43 on github/ReactiveCocoa August 27, 2012

Ah yes, missed that documentation. :S

I would prefer the return value be a tuple so I don't have to introduce side-effects (e.g., doNext:) to retrieve those values. I could achieve the same result with combineLatest:reduce: (where the reduceBlock is a simple identity, as in the change I proposed) but it might be nice to have a shorthand for that.

entry.title: bvanderveen commented on issue 43 on github/ReactiveCocoa
entry.content:
bvanderveen commented on issue 43 on github/ReactiveCocoa August 27, 2012

Currently, the subscribables passed to whenAll: have to side-effects to capture their values (if any). It would be nice if the value yielded by whenAll: was an ordered tuple of the values of the subscribables from which it was created, rather than a unit value.

entry.title: jspahrsummers commented on issue 43 on github/ReactiveCocoa
entry.content:
jspahrsummers commented on issue 43 on github/ReactiveCocoa August 27, 2012

This is what the method is documented to do. Are you saying that you would prefer a different interface? If so, what would be the motivation?

entry.title: bvanderveen opened issue 43 on github/ReactiveCocoa
entry.content:
bvanderveen opened issue 43 on github/ReactiveCocoa August 27, 2012
whenAll: always yields [RACUnit defaultUnit]

entry.title: dmishe commented on issue 31 on pkluz/ZUUIRevealController
entry.content:
dmishe commented on issue 31 on pkluz/ZUUIRevealController August 27, 2012

I just had this issue because both rear and front VCs had tableviews in them. I had to disable scrolls to top on rear view to fix it.

But I wonder what is the correct way to do this. Shouldn't rear VC remove itself and its view from the hierarchy when hidden?

entry.title: irrationalfab commented on pull request 429 on CocoaPods/Specs
entry.content:
irrationalfab commented on pull request 429 on CocoaPods/Specs August 27, 2012

Would it be OK to include those UVJSON files from Vendors to satisfy that.

This is definitely an acceptable solution which could suffice for now.

Or should I take a stab at forking uservoice-iphone-sdk to test for the existence of the proper SBJSON classes, and if present, use those instead and see if they'll pull that in?

Modifying the library to use SBJson would definitely be the best solution. In that case I think that you could contact the original author and ask him what he would.
